html:
That sendeth ambassadors by the sea, even in vessels. The ambassadors and "swift messengers" (D&C 124:26) are our "elders of Israel," our "messengers of the kingdom," or the Lord's servants who are working to establish Zion in the last days. They travel swiftly in a variety of vehicles, represented here with the phrase vessels of bulrushes, which means "vessels of speed," according to Joseph Fielding Smith.

a nation scattered and peeled, to a people terrible from their beginning hitherto. President Joseph Fielding Smith asked, "Do you know of any land like that? Terrible in the beginning and later meted out and scattered, peeled and a curse upon the land? That land is Palestine."
